course_title: Topics in Jewish Religion & Culture: Religion,Ethnography&Bioethics
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 8 / Seats Avail: 8Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as REL 358R 1, ANT 385 5)  This course will be taught online. It meets on Fridays. 
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Theme. 
This course examines the intersection of different religious and cultural traditions with the bioethics of assisted reproductive technologies such as IVF, gestational surrogacy, abortion and cloning. Is there one bioethics appropriate to these technologies?
course_description: This course will focus on particular aspects of or themes in Judaism or Jewish culture and how it is practiced. Topics will vary.
sections: Class Nbr: 4804, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 9:40a-12:35p, Instructor: D. Seeman, Status: Open
